title: The Best Healthy Snacks To Keep You Going
summary: KIND bars are made with whole grains, nuts, fruits, and spices. Dark cocoa is great for boosting mood and energy, and nuts and sea salt have nutrients that help to boost energy. Bananas are also great for the brain and help to improve focus, making them a great snack to keep you going throughout the day. Beans and legumes are one of the best sources of fiber that you can eat, and they’re also high in protein. Greek yogurt is a great option for snacking on the go, and it’s also good for the bones.

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Think about your typical work day. You probably spend the first few hours of it at your desk, sipping on a cup of coffee, reading emails, and maybe even taking a brief walk around the office to stretch your legs. Then you head back to your desk, only to dive into an afternoon filled with more reading and typing\u2014no time for walking again. And by 5pm you\u2019re ready to call it a day and head home. However, in that short span of time, you need to find some way to keep going through all those tasks. What do you do?
The answer is simple: Healthy snacks! Think about how much time you spend away from home throughout the day \u2013 whether it\u2019s at work or school, there are plenty of opportunities for snacking. In fact, keeping healthy snacks around can help boost your energy when you need it most. Check out these top-rated healthy snacks that will keep you going all day long\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of a Healthy Diet - And How to Stick to It

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`A healthy diet is a significant part of any healthy lifestyle. It\u2019s also one of the most difficult to maintain. With all the tempting fast food, vending machine snacks, and restaurants with cheap but high-calorie meals, it\u2019s not easy to eat right. Luckily, there are plenty of ways to make sticking to a healthy diet easier.
If you want to improve your health, increase your energy, and lose weight\u2014while still enjoying great food\u2014a healthy diet is the way to do it. A healthy diet can help prevent disease and keep you feeling great. Following these tips can get you well on your way towards meeting your nutrition goals and eating a balanced diet that will keep you happy and healthy for life.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get in Shape for Summer - Tips for Every Fitness Level

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When summer rolls around, everyone seems to want to look their best. After all, it\u2019s the season of tank tops, swimsuits, and short shorts. The problem is that not everyone hits the gym year-round or has access to a gym that fits their needs. If you tend to slack on your fitness game once the snow begins falling and leaves start falling from the trees again, now is the time to start making changes so that you\u2019re ready for summer.
Whether you\u2019re looking for ways to get back in shape after a long winter hibernation or just hoping to avoid ending up in an unflattering bathing suit this summer, hitting the gym as often as possible is essential. But what if you don\u2019t have a gym membership? Or what if you can only commit to working out at home? Luckily we have some great tips for how you can get in shape for summer no matter where you are.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 10 Easy Ways to Cut Sugar from Your Diet

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`In recent years, sugar has received a lot of negative attention. From the link between sugar and obesity to the prevalence of diabetes, research on sugar and its potential health effects continues to grow.
There are many different types of sugars out there, but common table sugar or sucrose is the one you need to cut back on. Eating too much sugar can lead to weight gain, high blood pressure and other health problems. If you\u2019ve read any articles about how bad sugar is for you, then you probably already know this. However, cutting back on sugar isn\u2019t always easy. Sugar is in almost everything! Luckily, we\u2019ve compiled a list of 10 super helpful tips that will teach you how to cut back on your intake of this not-so-nice white substance\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Your Home a Haven

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Creating a home is something that we all strive to achieve. For most, this is somewhere to relax and unwind after a hard day\u2019s work. It also needs to be somewhere that feels safe, somewhere where we can shut out the troubles of the world and just be ourselves. Creating a home is no easy feat though, especially when you consider all the things you need to consider from furnishing, decorating and creating spaces that feel like ours. That being said, creating your perfect home doesn\u2019t have to be as difficult as it sounds. There are plenty of ways in which you can make your home your own personal haven. Below are some tips on how you can transform your home into your very own haven..."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Time for Self-Care When You're Busy
How to Stick to Your Healthy Eating Goals

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The New Year brings new resolutions and the challenge to stick to them. But how can you make sure you succeed this time? Planning and preparation are key to any endeavor, including sticking to your healthy eating goals in the New Year. Thinking ahead and making a plan will help you avoid pitfalls and stay on track. After all, it\u2019s not about failing once but rather keeping failure at bay so it doesn\u2019t creep up again next year.
Many people struggle with their eating habits because they lack structure or fail to plan ahead. That\u2019s why creating a strategy is essential if you want to maintain this commitment for good. Whether it\u2019s going on a diet, cutting out certain foods or reducing your intake of fats, proteins or carbs \u2013 there are different ways how you can achieve your goals. Here are some helpful tips:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with Cravings and Temptations
How to Create a Healthy Grocery List on a Budget

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:o,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:o,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you\u2019re on a tight budget, it can feel like hitting up the grocery store is one of the last things you can afford to do. However, there are ways to make your food dollars go further and still eat well.
Instead of making weekly trips to multiple stores and markets, plan a shopping day and hit one store at a time. Look for sales in that store before you go and stock up on foods that are good value. You might even consider investing in a membership card or becoming an insider or club member so you get vouchers or other discounts. Adding your own spin on some classic cheap meals will also help you save money without sacrificing nutrition. It just takes some planning and research to make it work!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Moving When You Don't Have Time for the Gym

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`New Year, same old resolutions. If you\u2019re anything like the majority of people, chances are that you have made the same resolution to get fitter, healthier and happier this year as you did last year. But with a packed work schedule, social calendar and everything else going on in your life it can be difficult to find time to hit the gym or take up that new Zumba class you signed up for last October but never went to again.
And yet so many of us do manage to get moving. Yes, it might involve setting your alarm an hour earlier than usual, waking up on Saturday morning instead of Friday night and putting in some serious dedication \u2014 but it is possible. So if you\u2019re struggling to find time for the gym here are some creative ways how you can get moving when you don\u2019t have time for the gym:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
